intro: Genosiris sericea, commonly known as the silky genosiris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Genosiris sericea is often found in moist, shady woodlands and along stream banks. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive, silky appearance that helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat.
